1.verse: O LORD, rebuke me not in thy wrath: neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

2.verse: For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand presseth me sore.

3.verse: There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sin.

4.verse: For mine iniquities are gone over mine head: as an heavy burden they are too heavy for me.

5.verse: My wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness.

6.verse: I am troubled; I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long.

7.verse: For my loins are filled with a loathsome disease: and there is no soundness in my flesh.

8.verse: I am feeble and sore broken: I have roared by reason of the disquietness of my heart.

9.verse: Lord, all my desire is before thee; and my groaning is not hid from thee.

10.verse: My heart panteth, my strength faileth me: as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.

11.verse: My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore; and my kinsmen stand afar off.

12.verse: They also that seek after my life lay snares for me: and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and imagine deceits all the day long.

13.verse: But I, as a deaf man, heard not; and I was as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.

14.verse: Thus I was as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.

15.verse: For in thee, O LORD, do I hope: thou wilt hear, O Lord my God.

16.verse: For I said, Hear me, lest otherwise they should rejoice over me: when my foot slippeth, they magnify themselves against me.

17.verse: For I am ready to halt, and my sorrow is continually before me.

18.verse: For I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.

19.verse: But mine enemies are lively, and they are strong: and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.

20.verse: They also that render evil for good are mine adversaries; because I follow the thing that good is.

21.verse: Forsake me not, O LORD: O my God, be not far from me.

22.verse: Make haste to help me, O Lord my salvation.
